definition: to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else

sentences.english: Dates become a series of business negotiations, often hard-nosed.
sentences.chinese: 约会成为一系列商务谈判，常常就像讨价还价。

sentences.english: She was bargaining about the goods in the market.
sentences.chinese: 她在市场上为买商品讨价还价。

sentences.english: They dickered for hours over some of the details of the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 他们就协议的某些细节讨价还价了好几钟头。

sentences.english: After they had haggled for sometime, the two men decided to close the bargain.
sentences.chinese: 那两个人经过一番讨价还价以后，决定成交。

sentences.english: Democracy 102 was the way the Tea Party representatives managed their bargaining position.
sentences.chinese: 民主102原则体现在茶党代表讨价还价的管理办法。

sentences.english: The cook and the grocer haggled over the price of eggs.
sentences.chinese: 厨师和杂货商为蛋的价格讨价还价。
他们不能和傀儡讨价还价。

sentences.english: Last, I have to say "bargain" is not niggard.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我要说，讨价还价，不等于小气。
他们为买卖商品讨价还价。

sentences.english: The unions bargained with management for a shorter working week.
sentences.chinese: 工会为缩短工作周而与资方讨价还价。

sentences.english: The women are bargaining with the dealers for the property.
sentences.chinese: 妇女们与商人就那笔房地产的交易讨价还价。

sentences.english: I appear to have bartered over the buffer zone and haggled the soldier down.
sentences.chinese: 看来我对缓冲区的讨价还价成功了，士兵终于让了步。

sentences.english: Predictions on the impact of bar- gaining power on outcomes are not clear cut.
sentences.chinese: 针对讨价还价实力对谈判结果影响的预测尚不明晰。

sentences.english: Haggling over price and delivery date is common.
sentences.chinese: 就价格和交期进行讨价还价是很普通的。

sentences.english: The worker bargained his services to the highest bidder.
sentences.chinese: 讨价还价后这名工人受雇于出价最高的雇主。

sentences.english: He would rather die than dicker over prices.
sentences.chinese: 他宁愿死也不愿意讨价还价。

definition: to make a counteroffer when haggling/to bargain
to beat down the price/to haggle/to slash one's prices
to bargain/to haggle with a peddler
to bargain/to cut or beat down a price
to wear out the skin of one's teeth (idiom); pointlessly blather/to talk incessant nonsense/blah blah
to buy and sell/to do business/to trade/to deal
extortion by taking advantage of sb's weakness
to confer/to discuss/to engage in talks
